sub_title: FDW Program Coordinator & PvW Bangladesh Advisor
summary: An operational and programme management professional with over 20 years (7yrs in Bangladesh) of private and development sector work experience (donor and INGO), specializing in project and portfolio management, Disaster Risk Management (DRM), Water Resource Management, Drinking Water and Sanitation, Training, Grants Management and Resource mobilization of private sector and institutional donor funded projects.

profile_positions.title: FDW program coordinator and PvW Bangladesh Advisor

profile_positions.description:
I work as a project advisor Global Public Goods for the department of International Programs of the Rijksdienst voor Ondernemend (RVO), of the Government of the Netherlands.

The department implements, on behalf of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, different Public Private Partnership (PPP) subsidies, which include the Fonds Duurzame Ontwikkeling en Voedselzekerheid (FDOV), Fonds Duurzaam Water (FDW) en Ghana WASH Window (GWW).
profile_positions.title: Advisor Global Public Goods

profile_positions.description:
•	Managed a €70M portfolio of 10 programs targeting 30 million stakeholders (175 Upazila’ s) in rural drinking water & sanitation (BRAC/MAX Foundation/UNICEF/WHO/UNHCR), public private partnerships in urban dredging, water supply (VEI-DWASA) and Industrial Waste Water (IFC/Solidaridad), Integrated Water Resource Management/Transboundary Dialogue/Climate Change Adaptation (UNDP/ILO/IUCN), Food and Cash for Work (WFP) Gender and Water (GWA), Satellite for Crop and Flood Early Warning (DDM/FFWC/BRAC/CEGIS/IWM/Deltares). 
•	Contract managed 11 implementing partners (UN, INGO/NGOs, Private Sector Organizations, Public Utilities, Consultancy firms) which included reviewing and approving the following; concept notes and project proposals, inception reports, financial and narrative reports, fund disbursements and frequent monitoring of field level activities for quality assurance. 
•	Development of annual budgets and plans, its tracking and reporting, as well monitoring of partners financial management through audits and field visits.  
•	To ensure embassy program integration and quality, worked with Food Security, Economic, Sexual and Reproductive Health and Rights staff (as well as government counterparts in ERD, LGED, LGRD, DOE, DPHE, WARPO, DDM etc.), for developing and funding integrated programs, joint monitoring and evaluation, monthly program meetings and annual lessons learnt and reflection workshops. 
•	Represented the Embassy in coordination, networking and policy dialogue forums with government (LCG Water and WASH), private sector (trade missions), multilateral donors/institutions and NGOs.  
•	Carried out regular policy reviews and sector analysis to inform management on latest developments, trends and sector priorities as well as support in external water sector communications, media interviews, speech writing, website updates etc.
profile_positions.title: Policy Advisor Water

profile_positions.description:
•	Established and managed a $2M global DRM program, budget, quarterly training plan and staff database.
•	Managed, monitored and evaluated the roll out of the global DRM training program across 49 program countries and four regional offices, resulting in the training of 2K operational and programmatic staff.
•	Managed 7 consultancy agencies in developing and piloting face-to-face and e-learning trainings on logistics, security, leadership and management, child protection and education in emergencies, rapid needs assessment, emergency programme design, disaster risk reduction and climate change.
•	Served as a Project Manager for a $300K AusAID and $200K Irish Aid funded capacity building projects.
•	Co-delivered five face-to-face regional and country level trainings to over 100 staff in leadership and management for emergencies and rapid needs assessment.
•	Supported the development of $20K to $3M donor and corporate proposals for Australian AID, ECHO, Irish Aid, DFID and corporate donors such as Cisco, in support of ten fundraising offices.
•	Managed a capacity building program of 20 regional ‘GO team’ staff (deployable within 24hrs), including supporting real time evaluations and dissemination of lessons learnt.
•	Supported the development of the Plan’s Emergency Response Guidelines and SOPs for regional and country office.
profile_positions.title: Training Manager – Disaster Risk Management (DRM)

profile_positions.description:
•	Developed, mobilized resources, and implemented a five year DRM and Climate change country strategy.
•	Designed and managed the Sidr cyclone response/rehabilitation program, as well as four small scale flooding and cold snap emergencies, in coordination with GOB, UN clusters, ECB and affected communities.
•	Managed donor contracts and compliance, HR, logistics, programme schedules, and quarterly/final project narrative and financial reports.
•	Conducted a local and national child rights situation analysis and planning exercises involving multiple stakeholders to support the development of the five year country programme strategy.
•	Managed three country and fifteen field staff responsible for DRR, CCA and humanitarian response.
•	Managed two cycles of $400K DIPECHO funded Child Centred Disaster Risk Reduction projects targeting communities in two rural districts and ten urban slums in Dhaka and developed NARRI project proposal. 
•	Managed a joint $2 million UNICEF funded Education in Emergencies (EiE) project with Save the Children UK and ten implementing partners to strengthen 2K educational institutions’ disaster plans.
•	Managed the Action Research for Community Adaptation (ARCAB) action research project to support children and communities adapting to a changing climate. 
•	Oversaw program monitoring and evaluation through establishing an MIS, and conducting base and end lines, mid and final external and peer evaluations.
profile_positions.title: Programme Manager – Disaster Risk Management (DRM)

profile_positions.description:
•	Trained 3 local implementation NGO partners in operational grants management, project cycle management, and Community Based DRM activities to implement participatory vulnerability assessments, early warning mechanisms, and capacitate school and local authority disaster management committees.
•	Designed, implemented, and evaluated community and school based disaster preparedness activities, such as contingency planning, structural and non-structural mitigation, simulations, quizzes, and teacher training.
profile_positions.title: Capacity Building Coordinator

profile_positions.description:
•	Co-created an eco-sanctuary for rejuvenating fish stock through managing 3 staff and 40 volunteers. 
•	Supervised the timely purchase, allocation, and distribution of food and project equipment to 150 project staff and participants in nine project sites.
profile_positions.title: Project Manager / Assistant Logistics Manager
